TopicTitle: Imgur Album embedding no longer working inside spoiler tags

Articles.Content:
A quirk I just noticed when looking at some old mission reports, imgur albums hidden in spoiler tags no longer display properly. I know this worked before and there are a few old posts around that are affected. I can't say when it stopped working, sorry.

Example:

This works:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Enclose the same tags in spoilers:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited October 4, 2014 by Red Iron Crown
Hmm, we didn't change anything about our spoiler tag, so I think imgur changed something on their end.
Imgur has been playing up for me for a few weeks now, galleries not loading, can't upload pics, that sort of stuff :/
That gallery in the spoiler displays fine for me. :/

That gallery in the spoiler displays fine for me. :/

On my home PC running Win7 and Firefox it didn't display pictures at all. On my work PC with XP and Chrome it seems to work, though the first picture looks like a thumbnail the first time it's viewed. Weirdness.

Really bizarre. Imgur album-views on the KSP Forum have been so buggy for me as of late that I basically have to avoid any posts that use them. They cause a run-away formatting bug that results in the length of the page (and the post they're in) to increase forever. Possibly the formatting enforced by the Spoiler tags (however you've implemented that) is interfering with the album-view javascript in a new and interesting way?

And I get different reflexes entirely:

- On iOS, the album in the Spoiler tags appears with 1/10th sized images. The album outside of it looks fine.

- On OS-X, everything looks fine in Safari, but I get the same 1/10th result in Chrome as on iOS.

Edit: Yet the images return to their correct size if I click through the album. Really strange bug there.

I added in something to prevent spoiler from becoming wider than the page, let me know if that works or not. About the imgur albums not working correctly I'm afraid that's something imgur will have to solve. I don't see a way for us to do it.
